## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 278, 904, 292]]<|/det|>
0580/33  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 301, 287, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Calculator (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[780, 302, 904, 316]]<|/det|>
May/June 2025  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[755, 326, 904, 340]]<|/det|>
1 hour 30 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 384, 398, 399]]<|/det|>
You will need: Geometrical instruments  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 221, 432]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 434, 855, 618]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You should use a scientific calculator where appropriate.- You may use tracing paper.- You must show all necessary working clearly.- Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.- For \(\pi\) , use either your calculator value or 3.142.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 649, 212, 662]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 665, 728, 696]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 80. The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 72, 567, 87]]<|/det|>
List of formulas 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 115, 680, 141]]<|/det|>
Area, \(A\), of triangle, base \(b\), height \(h\). \(A = \frac{1}{2} bh\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 168, 675, 188]]<|/det|>
Area, \(A\), of circle of radius \(r\). \(A = \pi r^2\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 216, 675, 234]]<|/det|>
Circumference, \(C\), of circle of radius \(r\). \(C = 2\pi r\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 263, 686, 281]]<|/det|>
Curved surface area, \(A\), of cylinder of radius \(r\), height \(h\). \(A = 2\pi rh\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 310, 670, 328]]<|/det|>
Curved surface area, \(A\), of cone of radius \(r\), sloping edge \(l\). \(A = \pi rl\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 358, 686, 376]]<|/det|>
Surface area, \(A\), of sphere of radius \(r\). \(A = 4\pi r^2\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 408, 664, 426]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of prism, cross-sectional area \(A\), length \(l\). \(V = Al\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 450, 680, 480]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of pyramid, base area \(A\), height \(h\). \(V = \frac{1}{3} Ah\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 504, 680, 523]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of cylinder of radius \(r\), height \(h\). \(V = \pi r^2 h\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 550, 694, 579]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of cone of radius \(r\), height \(h\). \(V = \frac{1}{3}\pi r^2 h\) 

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 599, 684, 627]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of sphere of radius \(r\). \(V = \frac{4}{3}\pi r^3\)
